translation2: All Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools are carefully inspected, tested, and subject to the strict controls of Bosch's quality assurance. Therefore, Bosch provides a warranty for Bosch electrical tools, pneumatic tools, and measuring tools. This warranty does not limit the defect liability claims of the buyer from the purchase contract with the seller or statutory rights. For these tools, we provide a warranty in accordance with the following conditions: We provide a warranty in accordance with the following regulations (No. 2-7) by repairing defects in the tool free of charge, which are demonstrably due to a material or manufacturing defect within the warranty period. The warranty period is 24 months, for commercial or professional use or equivalent use 12 months. The warranty period begins with the purchase by the first end user. The date on the original purchase receipt is decisive. For all tools purchased after September 1, 2004, commercial blue electrical tools and measuring tools (excluding high-frequency tools, industrial battery screwdrivers, and pneumatic tools), the warranty period is extended to 36 months if the buyer registers these tools within 4 weeks after the purchase date. Battery packs and chargers, as well as accessories supplied, are excluded from this warranty extension. Registration can only be made on the Internet at [www.bosch-pt.com/warranty](http://www.bosch-pt.com/warranty). The registration confirmation is the registration receipt, which must be printed out immediately, as well as the original purchase receipt from which the purchase date can be determined. Registration is only possible if the buyer agrees to the storage of the data to be entered there. Excluded from the warranty are parts that are subject to wear and tear or other natural wear, as well as defects in the tool that can be attributed to wear and tear or other natural use, abnormal environmental conditions, unauthorized use, overload, or lack of maintenance or care. Defects in the tool caused by the use of accessory, supplementary, or replacement parts that are not Bosch original parts. Tools on which changes or additions have been made. Minor deviations from the specified properties that are immaterial to the value and usability of the tool. The repair of the defect we recognize as warranty-bound takes place in such a way that we repair the defective tool free of charge or replace it with a faultless tool (if necessary also with a successor model). Replaced tools or parts become our property.

translation2: Tire choice for racing bikes - really that safe from punctures? This morning I woke up full of motivation to train a little in preparation for my upcoming bike tour next week. Said, done, and I rode with my racing bike, which I bought yesterday on eBay. The first 40km were also really nice - but then, what lurks in every city (this time: thanks, Krefeld!) happened. Glass shards on the route. Bang, loud hissing, and my rear tire didn't want to participate in the rest of the route at all. Since I didn't have a real opportunity to buy a replacement tube and tire on a weekday, I had to turn around with a somewhat bad mood and take the first train back home. It wasn't technically so bad, maybe it's better if I practice tire changing again before the bike tour. Now I'm facing a question and hope you can help me. Since I have a rather long distance to cover over several days, I would really rather not have this problem often. It wasn't really bad this time, since the old tires from the previous owner (a very nice old man who had ridden 120km by the time I picked up the bike on the day he was selling it) were already suboptimal and he had described them as such because he had been riding on them for several years. But if I think about it, I have to change the tire again after 80-90km, then I'm really in a bad mood :D Now I'm talking to an older man at the platform, who asked me why I didn't have Marathon Plus tires; these are supposed to be puncture-proof. Of course, this all sounds very tempting now. But are they really that indestructible? I have little desire to spend 40€/tire now, just to be disappointed later. Furthermore, I'm wondering: I believe I have 25x622 on my racing bike. There are apparently also these sizes (seemingly?) available with the Marathon Plus tires, but the majority are wider. Is this a problem? Or would you recommend other tires to me for a racing bike in general? The Schwalbe website seems to recommend the Durano DD to me as a layman? Thank you in advance for your help and best regards!

translation2: "Party, die wir schmeißen wollten": Frankfurt feiert nach torreichem Comeback gegen Leverkusen Was für eine spektakuläre Reaktion von Eintracht Frankfurt. Nach 22 Minuten befanden sich die zuletzt zweimal in Serie sieglosen Hessen vermeintlich auf dem Weg zur nächsten Bundesliga-Pleite. Doch dann drehte die SGE auf, schoss sich innerhalb von einer guten Stunde den Frust über einen durchwachsenen Saisonstart von der Seele und siegte furios mit 5:2. "Es ist Wahnsinn, was die Jungs heute geleistet haben", jubelte Trainer Oliver Glasner bei DAZN und sprach ein "Pauschal-Lob, an jeden einzelnen, der mit dabei war", aus. Dabei sah es anfangs nach einem erneuten Dämpfer für die nun auf Rang neun nach wie vor hinter ihren Erwartungen stehenden Frankfurter aus. Patrik Schick hatte die Leverkusener mit 2:0 in Führung gebracht. Was dann geschah, beeindruckte auch den SGE-Trainer. "Wie die Spieler dann wieder zurückgekommen sind und eine fantastische Leistung gezeigt haben", so Glasner weiter. Ich bin wahnsinnig happy mit der Leistung, die wir gezeigt haben und natürlich auch mit dem Ergebnis. Auch Abwehrspieler Christopher Lenz, der erstmals seit dem vierten Spieltag und seiner überwundenen Muskelverletzung wieder auf dem Platz stehen konnte, betonte die Moral seiner Teamkollegen. "Ich glaube, unsere Mentalität ist unglaublich groß", sagte der 27-Jährige und freute sich mit einem Blick auf das Ergebnis insbesondere für die Zuschauer. Das war die Party, die wir heute schmeißen wollten. Für die kommenden Aufgaben will Glasner aber nun den Fokus bei sich behalten, sieht sich dafür aber auch hinsichtlich der Personal-Situation gut aufgestellt. Es ist außergewöhnlich, dass wir alle Spieler fit haben im Dezember, dass alle Spieler körperlich in einer Top-Verfassung sind. Es ist Top-Arbeit in unserer medizinischen Abteilung, aber auch die Spieler leben hochprofessionell. Nun wolle man "Schritt für Schritt weitergehen und bescheiden bleiben" und die Aufgaben bis zum Jahreswechsel "auf diesem Niveau durchziehen". Als nächstes steht schon am Mittwoch im Zuge der englischen Woche ein Auswärtsspiel bei Borussia Mönchengladbach (18.30 Uhr, Sky) auf dem Programm.
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "5", "Explanation": "The text is highly fluent in German. All grammar and syntax are correct. There are no errors or strange phrases. All the sentences and thoughts are very clear and easy to understand." } }

translation2: Problems with fiber optic + Devolo DLan/Magic  We have had a new fiber optic connection in the house for a few weeks. Unfortunately, I am now having trouble building a stable Wi-Fi network. Previously, I had a DSL 50 Mbit connection and used Devolo DLan, which received and transmitted 50 Mbit flawlessly except for a few failures. The new fiber optic connection sends 500 Mbit to the FritzBox 7590 and at the DLan module connected to the FritzBox, these are also received. However, at the other DLan module that transmits the Wi-Fi, only a fraction of the full 500 Mbit comes through, and the more I move away from the module with the device (e.g., using a socket that is 1, 2, 3, etc. rooms away), the less comes through (i.e., a socket that is further away from the other module). This leads to the internet with the new fiber optic connection now being slower in the first floor than before (~45 Mbit). I have also ordered a new Devolo Magic Set, which apparently uses a new technology. This was slightly better than the DLan, but here too, there were similar losses. Could someone explain why so much internet speed is "lost" over the power line with fiber optic? And is LAN really the only solution? It would be extremely time-consuming to lay more LAN cables in the house. I am really at my wit's end, which is why I created this account. Therefore, I would be all the more grateful for a response.

translation2: Since its introduction in 2001, the Valvetronix series from VOX has continuously evolved, among other things, to the combination of advanced modeling technology with the "Valve Reactor" circuit, which perfectly replicates the behavior of a tube amplifier. With the VT20X/VT40X/VT100X amps, we are introducing a brand new modeling engine that is absolutely state-of-the-art in terms of sound. Thanks to the VET technology (Virtual Element Technology), which is based on the analysis of components and amp circuits, the VTX amplifiers offer an authenticity that is absolutely impressive. Of course, these amps also include the multi-stage Valvetronix tube preamplifier. This is based in part on real analog circuits because they simply better capture the sound variations and nuances of a tube amplifier than any simulation. In addition to this sophisticated circuitry, the VTX amplifiers feature a closed housing and a bass reflex system from which the natural resonances simply burst forth. With the "Tone Room" software from VOX, you can even correct and adjust historical facts on the virtual level until the amp and effects sound exactly as you always imagined them. The perfect combination of tube sound with modeling technology is primarily due to the 2001 introduced VOX Valve Reactor technology. Of course, it has been refined several times since then to meet new sound requirements, which in 2010 led to a performance boost of the VOX Valvetronix series - with more dynamics and numerous and significantly improved amplifier models. From the handy VT20+ to the VT120+ with two speakers, the new VT+ Valvetronix series has been designed so that all guitarists looking for maximum sound variety will find what they are looking for. All guitarists dream of the pressure and dynamics of a tube amplifier: they expect a fat sound, a nuanced reproduction of playing dynamics and string attack, and a prompt response. During an in-depth analysis, VOX engineers discovered that the output stage in particular determines the tube character of an amplifier and developed the VOX Valve Reactor technology based on this finding. The Valve Reactor circuit of each VT+ amplifier, equipped with a 12AX7 tube, perfectly replicates the behavior, subtle nuances, and sound character of a tube amplifier.

translation2: Federal Minister of Building, Klara Geywitz: Expropriation does not create new apartments. The new Federal Minister of Building, Klara Geywitz (SPD), has spoken out against the expropriation of large apartment conglomerates, as has been demanded in a Berlin popular vote. "Expropriation does not create a single new apartment, it only changes the structure of ownership," said Geywitz in an interview with the "Tagesspiegel" (Sunday). My goal is to give tenants security that their rent will remain affordable in the coming years. A colorful mix of private landlords, cooperatives, or housing companies, by the way, is the best protection against the formation of a monopoly. In Berlin, the coalition of SPD, Greens, and Left Party plans to set up an expert commission to deal with how to handle the result of the popular vote. If the situation does not improve, Geywitz did not rule out talks with the FDP in the traffic light coalition about further tightening of rental law. The coalition agreement provides for a rental price brake until 2029, a limitation of rent increases in tight housing markets, and the expansion of the rental mirror. I will speak with the Justice Minister to implement this as quickly as possible. If the rental market does not improve nonetheless, "we will talk with the coalition partners about further steps," emphasized the SPD politician.

translation2: I am fed up with Sky Sport F1. Hello dear F1 fans, over the course of the season, the quality on German Sky has deteriorated more and more, so I want to vent a bit with this post. First of all, today during the F2 race, the broadcast was interrupted midway to start the F1 pre-coverage on time. Although the delayed start and the starting accident threw the schedule far behind schedule, they could still have shown the last (planned) ten minutes and the championship decision (!). Apparently, however, it is so that F1 has priority for legal reasons, so everything else has to be restricted, so that Sky DE here probably had no choice. Nevertheless, stupid, all the more since Sky UK was able to broadcast the race to the end. Nevertheless, a small compliment: the commentator Olivier Zwartjes did a good job of accompanying the difficult situation around the heavy accident. Then there was F1 again confusion about the rules among the commentators Sascha Roos and Ralf Schumacher, as both did not know that you can change tires under a red flag. Although there was already such a situation in Imola, Baku, and Silverstone this year, both only came to the conclusion that Verstappen can change tires when there were corresponding radio messages to Hamilton. Both commentators at Sky UK and RTL knew immediately that this was possible for Verstappen. I am of the opinion that such elementary rules should simply be known when commentating on F1 at a pay-TV broadcaster. It is also not the first time that now, according to the rules, something is possible or required, both have constant uncertainties in the rules. Generally, I don't like the artificial commentary style of Roos, but I have to admit that taste is subjective. But even Heiko Wasser from RTL is better. In addition, there are constant silliness that both simply make them look unprofessional, such as ordering coffee from (equally clueless) reporter Peter Hardenacke or "UuuuuHD" from Ralf Schumacher. The latter in particular brings a lot of chaos into the commentary, which he apparently does not take seriously. Not least, the advertising simply takes over at Sky, in the out-lap, Sky is the only broadcaster that goes into advertising, as can be heard on F1TV, only the German soundtrack without commentary is necessary directly after the race. Neither ServusTV nor ORF do this. Also, these two broadcasters make less advertising during training than Sky, and that as a free-to-air broadcaster. Of course, one must praise Glock and Baumgartner for their work, but that alone does not make up for the disadvantages. The rest of Sky Sport F1's program is also very meager and full of repeats. Overall, Sky is really the worst German-language broadcaster that broadcasts F1. Unironically, RTL does a better job with the four races they are still allowed to broadcast, apart from the advertising. Thus, the great F1 season makes much less fun than it would be with a reasonable broadcaster. I would like to hear your opinion.
gpt_response: { "Fluency": { "Score": "4", "Explanation": "The text is overall very fluent, with minor grammatical errors and sentence structure issues that do not completely hinder understanding. And in some instances, the sentence structure does feel a bit clumsy and could be improved for better readability, such as 'I am of the opinion that such elementary rules should simply be known when commentating on F1 at a pay-TV broadcaster.' The interventions of the vocabulary and ideas are appropriate and coherent so the errors do not greatly interfere with comprehension." } }

translation2: Rotinger brake discs are designed to meet the demands of dynamic drivers who appreciate the reliability and safety of braking even under difficult conditions. Rotinger brake discs are manufactured by casting and then mechanically processed (drilled and cut). All custom-made discs are produced in short series according to individual technical specifications that are unique to certain discs and designs. The thus produced custom-made discs ensure high comfort and braking efficiency. translation2: Basketball Bundesliga: Derby disaster for MHP Riesen Ludwigsburg against Merlins Crailsheim At least one youngster, Johannes Patrick, held up for the Riesen. For the second time in less than three months, Ludwigsburg lost in Crailsheim - and how! Before the game, Ludwigsburg's coach John Patrick had said with hindsight on the cup defeat at the beginning of October against the Hakro Merlins Crailsheim: "We still have some anger in our stomachs." But that didn't settle after the game - instead, it escalated in the face of the 61:72 (28:38) defeat in the Basketball Bundesliga. More than the bare result, it was the manner of the appearance that was disappointing. A statistic that sums up the entire dilemma can be cited: the three-point percentage was just 13 percent, four baskets (all from the young Johannes Patrick) in 31 attempts - any questions? The answer came from John Patrick: "We weren't concentrated enough after our win in Tenerife and didn't implement what we trained for - moving the ball." His counterpart, Sebastian Gleim, reacted quite differently: "It was great to win for the second time against Ludwigsburg," said the happy coach. "It felt like playing in front of 10,000 people." Although only 750 spectators were allowed in the Hohenlohe Arena on Saturday, they made up for it. Not least because of BBL top scorer T.J. Shorts, who scored 22 points and led the game for his team. "The best playmaker I've ever trained," Gleim added. While in Patrick's team, even the key players like Jordan Hulls (0 points) and Jonah Radebaugh (7) failed to deliver. Only in the last quarter (22:15) did the Riesen prevent a complete disaster and came within eight points after they had already trailed 39:59. Alongside Johannes Patrick, Justin Simon scored 12 points. Fortunately, there won't be much time for complaining. The Riesen will receive the Skyliners Frankfurt on Wednesday (6 pm) and then play in Ludwigsburg in front of a maximum of 750 spectators.

translation2: I also find it fundamentally that children should not be required to take on a parental role for their younger siblings. Perhaps that's why the psychologist's statement comes into play. translation2: Heavy "Huidlerer" question: Amberg knows the solution  What exactly is a "Huidlerer"? With this dialect word, sent in by someone from Amberg, a heated debate was sparked on the Bavarian TV show "Wir in Bayern". But unlike on many previous days, the term remained unguessed in the "Host mi?" segment by the callers. No, it wasn't a "person who is nervous" or "someone who has to do everything quickly". The viewers heard from the TV moderator that these guesses were completely wrong. Upon which the man from Amberg revealed the solution and thus probably surprised many people from the Upper Palatinate. "The Huidlerer", the viewers learned, "is a rag used to wipe the oven". Dialect researcher Anthony Rowley, who has been consulted as an expert by Bavarian Television for years, confirmed this. With the remark that this is a typical Upper Palatinate term, derived somehow from the better-known dialect word "Houdern". Thus, a gap in education was closed - probably also for many who have lived in the Amberg area for a long time.

translation2: Friedrich achieves 60th World Cup victory - Nolte wins in the two-man bob - Sport The brand of Norwegian biathlete Ole Einar Björndalen with 94 successes is the goal of the bobsleigh pilot. "I've calculated that, I would have to average nine and a half wins per season, then I could do it by Cortina 2026," said the double Olympic champion from BSC Oberbärenburg, who scored two successes in two days at the races in Winterberg. First, he fended off Johannes Lochner's attack by five hundredths on Saturday, moving from third to first. Then he changed something in the material setting and won by 0.30 seconds on Sunday with a larger lead. With his team Thorsten Margis (SV Halle), Candy Bauer (BSC Oberbärenburg) and Alexander Schüller (SV Halle), he beat Briton Brad Hall. Third became the Austrian Benjamin Maier. "We took a bigger risk today and were rewarded," said Friedrich, who also achieved his 22nd win in a row. Johannes Lochner from Stuttgart, who finished second this time, moved up to fifth. Christoph Hafer from BC Bad Feilnbach, who finished fourth in the first race, finished eighth in the second race. "If I knew what he was doing differently, I would do it too," said Lochner. Nolte with home win - Podium for Jamanka In the women's event, Laura Nolte won her third season victory in the two-man bob on her home track. After only fourth place in the Monobob the day before, she won the World Cup victory on Sunday with her pusher Deborah Levi as part of Germany's triple success. Two-man bob Olympic champion Mariama Jamanka from BRC Thüringen, with Germany's fastest sprinter Alexandra Burghardt from Burghausen, finished second. She not only qualified for the Olympics but also achieved her first podium finish this winter. The Wiesbadenerin Kim Kalicki finished third with Leonie Fiebig. "It was super cool, my first podium in the World Cup, I'm super happy that Mariama took me along. I'm super happy with the development. There is still a lot of potential to come, but the start times today were okay," said Burghardt and emphasized: "It's not just about pushing, there's a lot to do around it as well." Jamanka was a bit annoyed about the slightly flawed runs, but said: "It's going in the right direction."
